c74object.name: nw.recordplus~
c74object.description: Offers functionality similar to record~, but on/off changes are controlled by a signal and not executed until the next zero crossing in the audio signal. In addition, this object functions as though the loop and append options are always on.

inlet.description: Only values of 0. or 1. will be used.

inlet.digest: Audio signal: mono signal to be recorded.

objarg.name: buffer-name
objarg.description: The first argument names the buffer~ object whose sample memory will be used to record audio.

method.name: signal
method.description:
In left inlet: 1 starts recording, while 0 stops recording. Changes for both are delayed until the next zero crossing is detected in the signal. In the event that a zero-crossing is not detected between changes, no recording will occur.
In right inlet: mono audio signal to be recorded.

method.name: set
method.digest: Set the name of the buffer~ used for recording.
method.description: The word set, followed by the name of a buffer~ object, uses that object's sample memory as target for audio recording. Changes sent by the set message are deferred to the next time recording is turned on.

method.name: getinfo
method.digest: Post information about object to Max window
method.description: Retrieves basic information about the object author and when the object was last updated. Date can be used to identify different versions of the objects in circulation.
